page.title: 08Farming at Sandringham
page.content:
Most of the estate's 20,000 acres is tenanted, but 4000 acres including the land in our area is farmed by The Queen. 3,250 acres is arable land and 750 acres is put to grass. Soil-types vary from fertile fenland peat and free-draining chalkland to poor sandy heathland. Extensive irrigation takes place, water being taken from streams and deep boreholes. { {Crops Grown}- wheat, barley, sugar-beet, potatoes, peas & beans. Grass and forage crops are grown for feeding cattle.
{Stock} A herd of about 400 Blue-Grey cows is kept and crossed with Charolais or Simmental bulls. The calves are kept and fattened for between 18 months and 2 years before sale.
